rows.goal_2: * Explore expectations and set ground rules.
rows.title: Session Objectives

rows.goal_1: * Appreciate the importance of family relationships especially relations with one’s children and partner.
rows.goal_2: * Encourage participants to recruit their partners.
rows.title: Session Objectives

rows.goal_1: * Explore parenting goals and factors that facilitate the achievement of these goals.
rows.goal_2: * Explore parents’ current beliefs and practices regarding parent – child interaction.
rows.title: Session Objectives

rows.goal_1: * Explore the basic developmental needs and behaviors of children 0 – 17 years.
rows.goal_2: * Discuss the importance of fathers’ supportiveness during pregnancy and childhood
rows.goal_3: * Importance of parenting practices for children to reach their full potential.
rows.title: Session Objectives

rows.goal_1: * Reflect on the influence of parent figures on participants while they were growing up.
rows.goal_2: * Building on your parents’ positive influences, and avoid repeating their negative influences.
rows.title: Session Objectives

rows.goal_1: * We will explore positive parent-child interaction and reflect upon different styles of parenting which promote positive relationships and respectability
rows.title: Session Objectives

rows.goal_1: * We will explore the different styles of parenting and select on predominant one for your family
rows.title: Session Objectives

rows.goal_1: * We will reflect upon how gender norms can be harmful to both women and men, girls and boys and understand the impact of gendered power.
rows.goal_2: * Encourage men to commit to positive notions of ‘being a man’.
rows.title: Session Objectives

rows.goal_1: * Reflect on own experiences and common causes of spousal conflict.
rows.goal_2: * Discuss the effects of spousal conflict on parenting.
rows.goal_3: * Envision intimate relationships based on respect.
rows.title: Session Objectives

rows.goal_1: * Reflect on the time men and women dedicate to caring for their children and shaping their future.
rows.goal_2: * Improve men’s self–confidence and efficacy in caregiving.
rows.title: Session Objectives

rows.goal_1: * Learn how excessive drinking affects relationships and children and how to help a partner reduce alcohol consumption and other socially unacceptable practices.
rows.goal_2: * Explore what constitutes a healthy marriage and sexuality.
rows.goal_3: * Importance of father’s supportiveness during pregnancy and after birth.
rows.title: Session Objectives

rows.goal_1: * Identify the differences between punishment and discipline while exploring the effects of punishment on children’s development.
rows.goal_2: * Practising effective strategies for managing anger and disappointment.
rows.goal_3: * Explore how to positively and sensitively engage with children to promote respect.
rows.title: Session Objectives

rows.goal_1: * Encourage both parent and child to be accountable for the child’s education.
rows.goal_2: * Explore ways to increase parents’ engagement at school and cooperation with teachers.
rows.title: Session Objectives

rows.goal_1: * Understand the issues in which fathers and mothers tend to have different perspectives regarding child up-bringing
rows.goal_2: * To reflect on how to resolve different parenting roles for proper upbringing of children
rows.title: Session Objectives

rows.goal_1: * Exploring long-term goals for preventing sexual abuse and early sex.
rows.goal_2: *Facilitating healthy communication between parents and children about sexuality.
rows.title: Session Objectives

rows.goal_1: * Explore constructive ways of sharing information to avoid violent situation in relationships.
rows.goal_2: * Express personal needs and feelings and listen reflectively and empathically.
rows.title: Session Objectives

rows.goal_1: * Reflect on the participants’ experience of the programme
rows.goal_2: * To reinforce commitment to positive more equitable and respectful parenting
rows.goal_3: * To encourage continued meetings after the programme formally ends.
rows.title: Session Objectives
